title: Observation of Atomic Structure in Crocidolite Asbestos Using Low-dose STEM Imaging Techniques
content: For thousands of years ago, asbestos has been used for many kinds of applications, including building stuffs as insulation materials due to the excellent property such as nonflammability, heat resistance, chemical resistance and so on. It consists mainly of magnesium and iron silicate minerals and does not contain any harmful chemical elements. But its extremely fine morphology, known as asbestiform, allows it to easily become airborne and be inhaled into the human body. Then, inhaling asbestos fibers has a negative impact on the human body, potentially causing diseases such as lung cancer and mesothelioma.
